intro: Erythrodes lamprophylla, commonly known as the silver-leafed erythrodes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
